Description: Tall handmade beaker with rounded base and direct rim, in a deoxidised fabric. Vessel is black burnished on interior and exterior and decorated on the external wall with incised decoration, featuring: two incised lines below rim, separated by a line of punctate impressions; our columns of herringbone pattern made with rows of punctate impressions run from base to incised line below rim; an offering table in the centre of two columns made with neat punctate impressions. Base is marked by a circle of punctate impressions. Partially reconstructed, with a broken rim sherd that does not attach but is clearly from same vessel.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (419-420) (H11 ware)
